p: This work constitutes the first report of the chemical composition of EOs from leaves of M. septentrionalis and P. nubigenum. For the EO of the species M. septentrionalis, 93.78% of the chemical composition was determined, finding that this oil was characterized by containing monoterpenic ketones (menthone (8.17%) and pulegone (41.85%)) and sesquiterpenoids (Î²-caryophyllene (16.51%) and bicyclogermacrene (8.67%)). This class of compounds has been previously reported in other species of the genus Minthostachys and in the family Lamiaceae [ 34, 35]. The EO of P. nubigenum, 93.30% of the chemical composition was determined and its main components were myristicin (36.68%) and apiol (11.83%), compounds that are characteristic of some species of the genus Piper [ 36, 37].
